Description: Corroded copper alloy scarab, pierced lengthwise (now filled-up by corrosion), with elytra marked; no inscription visible on the base.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, but very probably from Tell Dafana according to the context of the item in the list. Maybe one of the two "small bronze scarabs" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 70.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 70)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.66, p.181, pl.23)
